text: All employees must adhere to data classification procedures as outlined in the internal guidelines.
Remote work arrangements require prior written approval from the relevant department head.
Access to sensitive systems is restricted to authorised personnel with appropriate clearance.
Password policies are reviewed annually to ensure alignment with current security standards.
Employees should report any suspected data breaches to the IT security team within 24 hours.
The organisation maintains comprehensive records of all access control decisions.
Training sessions on data handling procedures are conducted quarterly for all relevant staff.
Physical access to server rooms requires multi-factor authentication and logging.
Backup procedures are tested monthly to verify data integrity and recovery capability.
Incident response plans are updated following each significant security event.
All third-party service providers must comply with the organisation's data protection standards.
Encryption is required for all data transmissions involving personal or sensitive information.
Network segmentation is used to isolate critical systems from general-purpose infrastructure.
Disposal of electronic equipment follows certified data destruction procedures.
Role-based access controls are applied consistently across all information systems.
Software updates and patches are applied within the timeframes specified in the vulnerability management policy.
Business continuity plans are tested at least twice per year using tabletop exercises.
All security policies are subject to annual review and approval by the governance committee.
Visitor access to restricted areas requires escort by an authorised employee at all times.
Data retention schedules are maintained for each category of business record.
User accounts are deactivated within 24 hours of an employee's departure date.
Change management procedures apply to all modifications of production systems.
Penetration testing is conducted annually by an independent third party.
All wireless networks are secured using WPA3 or equivalent encryption standards.
The acceptable use policy defines permitted and prohibited activities on company systems.
